title: How to Make a BICtory Pen Mod for Pen Spinning

steps.headline: Requirements- You need two BIC® "round stic®" pens.
steps.description: These pens can be bought virtually anywhere, from office stores like Staples to shopping websites like Amazon. You also need a chopstick or a handy tool for removing the tip off of the pen, and a pair of scissors to cut the ink tubes. We will discuss that later in this article.

steps.headline: Take the caps off the two pens and then break the "clip" of the cap with your hand or the scissors.
Take the "front part" (the tip that you write with) out of both pens.
steps.description: It should come off along with the ink tube.

steps.headline: Remove the plug on the top of the pen with a chopstick.
steps.description: You can also use your teeth to bite off the plug. (NOTE: You only need to do this with one pen.)

steps.headline: Cut off about 7 mm off of each ink tube with scissors.
steps.description: This is important so the ink tubes can fit easier.

steps.headline: Now take the ink tubes and insert them into the pen with no "plug."
steps.description: They go in on each side. (NOTE: The tips may not exactly fit onto the pen. You might need to tape one of them in order for the tip to stay on.)

steps.headline: Take both of the pen caps and put them on.

tyn: 2 BIC round stic pens (or PaperMate Eagle pens)
A chopstick or your teeth (whichever one you prefer)
(Optional) Two Zebra Z-Grip retractable pens (you only need the grips and the pen tip)
